task.title: Washing clothes in stackable laundry machines
task.shortdesc: Instructions for using stackable laundry machines commonly found in shared housing facilities.

prereq.p: Students must use their own dryer sheets, wool balls, or any other products they would like to use.

step.cmd: Transfer the washed clothes from the washing machine to the dryer drum, located on top of the stackable unit.
Add dryer sheets or wool dryer balls to reduce static and add softness.
Select the appropriate drying settings on the dryer control panel, usually located above the dryer door.

info.note: Select a lower heat setting for delicate or synthetic fabrics to prevent damage.

step.cmd: Press the start button to begin the drying cycle.

taskbody.postreq: Users can always set a personal timer to keep track of the remaining wash and dry time.
